intro: Lundia puberula, commonly known as the hairy lundia, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, round berries as fruit. Lundia puberula is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
